DataElement.preferredName: Person Gene Mutation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for any questions related to the results of gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Gene Mutation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._change occurring in one gene._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A human being.:change occurring in one gene.

Concepts.definition: The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient's TCCs tumor har
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient's TCCs tumor harbor TSC1 or TSC2 mutation identified by a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have CLIA confirmed somatic KRAS G12R mutation as determined by sequence analysis of matched normal DNA from any specimen obtained from the individual?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a malignancy that contains a non-synonymous mutation, insertion, or deletion in the TP53 gene determined prior to screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the presence of biallelic loss of SETD2 been detected in tumor tissue using a CLIA-certified next generation sequencing panel (e.g. UCSF500, FoundationOne)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient in Cohort A have the presence of biallelic loss of SETD2 been detected in tumor tissue using a CLIA-certified next generation sequencing panel (e.g. UCSF500, FoundationOne)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have PTEN or PIK3CB mutated advanced solid tumor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient in Cohort A have the presence of pathogenic SETD2 mutation detected in tumor tissue using a CLIA-certified next generation sequencing panel (e.g. UCSF500, FoundationOne)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient in Cohort 2 have CLIA confirmed presence of a somatic or germline alteration in one or more of the DNA-repair genes tested in the FoundationOneÂ®CDx (F1CDx)  panel including the following genes: ABL1, ATR, ATRX, BARD1, BLM, BRD4, CCND1, CHEK1, CHEK2, DOT1L, FANCC, FANCD2, FANCE, FANCG, FANCL, IKBKE, MEN1, MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, MUTYH, NPM1, PMS2, POLD1, POLE, PRKDC, RAD50, RAD51, SMARCB1, STK11?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have one of the following specific mutations that lead to a neomorphic phenotype and include the following: IDH1: R132V, R132G, R132S, R132L, R132C, and R132H. For IDH2: R140W, R140L,R140Q, R172W, R172G, R172S, R172M and R172K, will be eligible for enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If enrolled in the Phase 2, RP2D, does patient have the presence of an actionable mutation in either PIK3CA gene or PTEN gene performed at a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had tumor sequencing for evaluation of actionable PIK3CA or PTEN mutations performed in a CLIA certified, CAP tested and bioinformatics-validated testing lab PRIOR to enrollment in this current protocol or if patient has not yet had tumor genomic assessment, after consultation with the PI, tumor specimens will be sent to the UNC Hospitals Clinical Molecular Genetics Laboratory for assessment of the Solid Tumor Mutation Panel?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have germline or somatic mutations in DDR genes: ARID1A, ATM, ATRX, BARD1, BRCA1, BRCA2, BRIP1, CDK12, CHEK1, CHEK2, FANCA, FANCL, MRE11A, MSH2, PALB2, PARP1, POLD1, PP2R2A, RAD51B, RAD51C, RAD51D, RAD54L, XRCC2; or actionable mutations in the PTEN gene, or hotspot mutations in the PIK3CA gene (E542, E545 or H1047 are accepted)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient in Cohort 2 have CLIA testing and fit the group with the confirmed presence of a cancer-associated alteration in one or more of the DNA-repair genes tested in the FoundationOne panel including the following genes: ABL1, ATR, ATRX, BARD1, BRD4, CCND1, CHEK1, CHEK2, DOT1L, FANCC, FANCE, FANCG, FANCL, IKBKE, MEN1, MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, MUTYH, NPM1, PMS2, POLD1, POLE, RAD51, SMARCB1, STK11?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known mutation status for PIK3CA and PTEN from archival tumor tissue analysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have PI3K pathway activating genomic alterations including inactivating mutations/deletions in PTEN and PIK3R1, amplifications in PIK3CA, and activating mutations in PIK3CA, Akt, or mTOR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient in Cohort 2 have CLIA testing and fit the group with the confirmed presence of a cancer-associated alteration in one or more of the DNA-repair genes tested in the FoundationOne panel including the following genes: ABL1, ATR, ATRX, BARD1, BRD4, CCND1, CHEK1, CHEK2, DOT1L, FANCC, FANCE, FANCG, FANCL, IKBKE, MEN1, MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, MUTYH, NPM1, PMS2, POLD1, POLE, RAD51, SMARCB1, STK11, TP53?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have the presence of an actionable mutation in either PIK3CA or PTEN on molecular testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have germline or somatic mutations in DDR genes: BARD1, BRCA1, BRCA2, BRIP1, FANCA, NBN, PALB2, RAD51, RAD51B, RAD51C, RAD51D, ; or actionable mutations in the PTEN gene, or hotspot mutations in the PIK3CA gene (E542, E545 or H1047 are accepted)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known SMARCB1- and SMARCA4-mutations?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are there SPOP mutations in prostate cancer cells, as indicated by Next Generation Sequencing (NGS)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has actionable mutations, treatment with Durvalumab during consolidative phase will be at physician discretion?

DataElement.changeDescription: 10/19/16 tt, released. 10/13/16 tt, 9767. Fix special char in Ref Doc 03-24-2020 DW
